doc.title: Huayu (A)
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/2Q25 beat on stronger sales diversifying outside SAIC continued PO RMB17 UP2Q25 beat on stronger sales diversifying outs_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: UNDERPERFORM | PO: 17.00 CNY | Price: 18.80 CNY

Huayu released 2Q25 results and hosted a conference call on 28 Aug: revenue came in at RMB44bn, up 10 YoY/10% QoQ, 10% ahead of our forecast. Gross margin was 11.9%, up 0.5ppt YoY/1.1ppt QoQ, slightly ahead of BofA at 11.6%. Operating income was up 17% YoY/81% QoQ, given a low base effect and also lower OPEX-to-sales ratio. Investment income came in at RMB755mn, up 13% YoY/14% QoQ. Net income came in at RMB1.6bn, up 1% YoY/27% QoQ, 21% higher than BofA. Huayu generated 64% sales outside of SAIC group in 1H25, up from 62% in 1H24, continuing the diversifying strategy outside SAIC group.

In 1H25, interior and exterior parts grew by 11% YoY, and functional parts grew by 17% YoY on solid growth from emerging external clients. Metal forming parts/electronics parts/heating processing parts declined by 14%/7%/25% YoY. Interior and exterior GPM was down 0.2ppt at 10.9%, while function parts GPM rose by 1.3ppt to 10.3%. Metal forming parts' GPM was 11.8%, flattish YoY, while electronics parts GPM came in at 9.1%, down 5.7ppt YoY. For the first time, XPeng became a Huayu top 10 client in 1H25, accounting for 1% of sales. Other key clients include BYD (7%), Tesla (6% of sales), Seres (6%), Geely (3%) and Chery (3%). Huayu acquired 49% stake in SAIC Qingtao, the solid-state and semi-solid-state battery brand, from its parent SAIC Group. The acquisition marks Huayu's strategy to penetrate into solid-state battery field.

We factor in 2Q25 results and raise 2025/26E revenue by 6%/8%, mainly reflecting stronger-than- expected interior & exterior parts and functional parts sales. We lift 2025/26E earnings by 10%/12%, respectively. Our new PO is RMB17 (RMB15.4 earlier). We mainly change our target multiple base from 2025E to 2H25- 1H26EPS, still based on 8x P/E multiple. We reiterate Underperform on Huayu as we expect the stagnant earnings in 2025- 26 to pose challenges for a re- rating.

Huayu is the largest auto parts manufacturer in China and headquartered in Shanghai. The company was initially established as an auto parts department of SAIC Group and then was injected into Shanghai Baishi Industrial (Group) (SBI) when the latter was restructuring, and renamed Huayu in 2009. SAIC Group is Huayu's largest shareholder which holds a \(58\%\) stake. The company went public on Shanghai Stock Exchange in 2009.

We have Underperform on Huayu given: 1) despite continuing to diversify out of the SAIC group, we fear the snowball effect of its sales decline could further hurt Huayu, 2) GPM pressure to persist longer into 2025 as pricing pressure and competition is unlikely to improve notably, 3) we see flattish 2025 earnings growth amid the weak demand and intense price competition.
2Q25 earnings read RMB1.6bn, up 1% YoY, exceeds our estimate
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH
We raise our 2025/26/27 EPS by 10%/12%/12%, respectively
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 3:Huayu's P&L summary (quarterly) We expect Huayu to report flatish earnings growth in 2025
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, company report

Our PO is RMB17, based on 8x on the sum of 2H25- 1H26E EPS. We arrive at our target multiple of 8x by 1SD lower than its past 2- years historical average PER. We believe this is justified as we forecast the earnings to decline in the coming years.
Upside risks: stronger auto demand, faster margin expansion in overseas plants.
Downside risks: sluggish economic and industry growth, rise in expenses due to consolidation of Shanghai Koito, short- term FX volatility, delay in EV products' launch.
